qas.question: In what area of London was the Tower of London built?
The Palace of Westminster originated from what building?
On what day did Duke William II of Normandy become King of England?
In which famous battle did Duke William II of Normandy see victory?

context: Following his victory in <a4_0>the Battle of Hastings<a4_0/>, William, Duke of Normandy, was crowned King of England in the newly finished Westminster Abbey on <a2_0>Christmas Day 1066<a2_0/>. William constructed the Tower of London, the first of the many Norman castles in England to be rebuilt in stone, in the <a0_0>southeastern corner<a0_0/> of the city, to intimidate the native inhabitants. In 1097, <a3_0>William II<a3_0/> began the building of <a1_0>Westminster Hall<a1_0/>, close by the abbey of the same name. The hall became the basis of a new Palace of Westminster.
